rationales.self_direction: Explicitly reflects that he left a comfortable role because he "didn't want to execute someone else's vision forever" and wanted to author his own direction.
rationales.achievement: Successfully delivered the Q3 roadmap, handled all questions without pushback, and received unsolicited validation from Arjun on the enterprise pivot he had been championing for two months.
rationales.power: Describes satisfaction at the team going quiet when he spoke and "knowing that I'm the one making the call" — actively seeking and enjoying authority and deference from others.
Vikram cut him off mid-pitch and the investor shifted attention to Vikram for the rest of the call — Rohan lost control of the room and accepted the subordination without pushing back.
rationales.conformity: Despite being undermined in front of an investor, he restrained himself and "didn't say anything," choosing social smoothness over asserting his authority.

rationales.achievement: Feels he "looks like he can't close" to the board because the pilot hasn't started — experiencing failure to demonstrate competence despite his CEO role.
rationales.power: Despite being CEO, he cannot move his own roadmap forward and is dependent on a mid-level procurement officer's approval — "I'm the CEO of this company and I can't move my own roadmap forward."

rationales.self_direction: Conceded to Vikram's pricing approach despite believing his own analysis was correct, surrendering his independent judgment to avoid appearing ego-driven.
rationales.power: Watched the team he recruited choose Vikram's direction over his, experiencing a direct loss of authority — "watching them choose someone else's direction over mine."
rationales.conformity: Agreed to Vikram's approach rather than continue fighting, because pushing further "would have made me look like I was digging in out of ego" — self-restrained to maintain social harmony.
rationales.tradition: References his father's unquestioned authority in his garment business as a model he finds meaningful, revealing respect for traditional patriarchal authority structures.

rationales.achievement: A younger founder's dismissal — "oh, still early then" — made him feel his three years of work aren't enough, revealing a sense of inadequate accomplishment.
rationales.power: A stranger treated his Series A as insignificant and turned away, diminishing his status; he sat in his car unable to shake the feeling that he hasn't achieved sufficient standing.
rationales.benevolence: Lied to Meera about why he was late — "I said traffic" — choosing to protect his self-image over being vulnerable and honest with his partner.
